intro: Vauquelinia corymbosa, commonly known as the Mexican flame flower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained, sunny locations. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types. Vauquelinia corymbosa is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as hummingbirds and butterflies.
